reviews.text: Love the AGA, great place to relax and immerse yourself in another world. The exhibits are well curated but just wish there were more (especially fine art and sculpture). Always a fun place to take people of all ages.

Surprised to find myself in this place but was quite delighted by what was on display and I enjoyed taking a look. For anyone looking to see some decent art, there is a quite a different range of works to see and there was a special exhibit when I went. They also have free entry one night a week - wednesday - a good time to visit. Place is well taken care of and in a good location downtown.

I have been to AGA many times now and the art is always interesting. It's quiet, not alot of people and the front desk is super nice. The only downside is that sometimes there's only one or two things to look at and then it's pretty much the end of what there is to see. It would be nice if there was more art!!!!
Went to an art show. Place was awesome.  Staff were knowledgeable and considerate towards me. Thanks for the experience Edmonton. Would love to come see more artsy stuff. :)

I love the art gallery and I try to attend each time they attain a new exhibit. I bring my children as they are well behaved and enjoy it. I also appreciate that children are free. Great value. Probably most culture I've experienced in all of Edmonton. The parking is a hectic and pricey mess though.

Love the AGA, great place to relax and immerse yourself in another world. The exhibits are well curated but just wish there were more (especially fine art and sculpture). Always a fun place to take people of all ages.

Surprised to find myself in this place but was quite delighted by what was on display and I enjoyed taking a look. For anyone looking to see some decent art, there is a quite a different range of works to see and there was a special exhibit when I went. They also have free entry one night a week - wednesday - a good time to visit. Place is well taken care of and in a good location downtown.

I have been to AGA many times now and the art is always interesting. It's quiet, not alot of people and the front desk is super nice. The only downside is that sometimes there's only one or two things to look at and then it's pretty much the end of what there is to see. It would be nice if there was more art!!!!
Went to an art show. Place was awesome.  Staff were knowledgeable and considerate towards me. Thanks for the experience Edmonton. Would love to come see more artsy stuff. :)

I love the art gallery and I try to attend each time they attain a new exhibit. I bring my children as they are well behaved and enjoy it. I also appreciate that children are free. Great value. Probably most culture I've experienced in all of Edmonton. The parking is a hectic and pricey mess though.

Got to experience this museum with a grade for class an amazing experience, to experience what school was like with a role playing teacher was intriguing on how school has changed over many years. I highly recommend this experience

My wedding ceremony was held at McKay Avenue Schoolhouse on August 5th, 2018. The building itself is gorgeous and perfect for bridal party pictures. The staff were very helpful and made sure the rehearsal and day of ran smoothly. I would definitely recommend future brides and grooms to consider McKay if they are looking for a historical building that is uniquely Edmonton to say "I do" in!

So... pretty much, I walked by McKay school on Saturday, July 2nd, at 5 am, and saw a boy's face in the window... I live in very close proximity and walk by the school every day; I've always expected to see a face in the window but it really freaked me out when I actually did see it today while least expecting it. Definitely haunted, would walk by again.

I have attended this historic building twice recently. The first was for a short retreat. We were placed in a well equipped classroom that had all the modern conveniences a conference room should have but in a historic setting with archival photos and memorabilia all around. 
The second visit was last night for a Christmas reception. The top floor of the school was the venue. It served as a gymnasium in the remote past and was the seat for a year of our provincial government (1906).  The venue served us well. History, decor, photos and memorabilia made it a nice place for our reception. The beautiful sloped ceiling has been restored and the roof above it replaced.
Lovely historical building
A hidden gem in Edmonton. A great place to go with friends and make sure to get the pizza. Definitely will go again.
My fave kilometre or so to bike in Edmonton. Apart from the tight squeeze (west side preferred). All seasons, fun to ride and the best, best views.
We always had a nice time, and we love driving on the bridge!!! And every time we drove by, we always take photos or videos!!!

Th High Level Street Car was Awesome. I highly recommend this when you are in Edmonton. Only 40mins of your time max . kids friendly easy travel.  And our Train Conductor named Ward is of the best gentleman and conductor ever. It was honor to meet Ward the conductor.

Always nice to walk across this bridge, especially at night when the lights are on, and it's a warm summer night with a cool breeze. It would be nicer if we didn't have to squeeze in slightly to avoid the suicide prevention barricades, but I agree with why they are there.
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.

Don't order from here as if you fall asleep you don't get your order or your money back so please don't order from little Italy pizza really bad review go to pizza hut as its a lot better than this place

I moved out of Aberdeen a year ago and what a loss it is not to have Little Italy around.. I simply cannot find a pizza restaurant with the same quality pizzas as this.

Expand! And for every newcomers, I highly recommend the Little Italy Calzone 12" if you like a bit spicy food!
Their sizes are a bit on the small side but otherwise great value for your money.

I went and ordered food throigh their website. The order was rejected due to them being too busy which I totally understand. However they proceeded to charge me twice and took the money out of my account. I emailed them and have not received any response. I am really not happy with this and this is slmesomet that people need to be avare off

The pizza is very good. I would say 7/10. I have tried the piri piri one and calzone. The number of ingredients in calzone is perfect. No option to order garlic sauce. Only garlic mayo available which taste very average. It is so easy to make garlic sauce, it should be a problem for the pizza place. The delivery time was shocking, 1:35, during the week. I cannot imagine waiting time during the peak times. Furthermore, the place is quite dear. It is not real Italian pizza therefore price should be lower. Why do I need to pay extra fee while ordering online through your website. I see the potential but some changes must be done.

Hands down the best place to bring kids for a few hours a week. Tons of fun, interactive exhibits. Great cafeteria with reasonable prices and good sized portions. The new space gallery is great. The new planetarium is amazing, my kiddo and I love laying down on the big bean bags and touring the galaxy. The rotating exhibits keep things fresh, especially when they're free admission exhibits. You have to work around the school classes, especially in the kids area (the new one seems like it'll be bigger thankfully). If you're allergic to loud, excited children then you might want to stick to early mornings or the adult-only Dark Matters nights. If you have kids, or want to recapture that feeling you had when you were a loud, excited child visiting the Space and Science Centre on a school trip, this is a definite recommend. And it has free parking! A GIANT free parking lot full of deliciously free parking. Freeeeeee!! (Apologies, I'm experiencing residual trauma from my visit to the new museum)

.... free parking

Great place for kids and date nights! Plenty of free parking, great food at the cafe. Amazing films at the IMAX theatre. Be sure to check out the science garage, and fish feeding in the environmental gallery. Nature exchange coming soon!

Very educational experience for the whole family or just with friends. I love that the exhibits are interactive. This interactivity helps you to learn and retain. Fun facts about the planets and your body. Great indoor activity especially in our long winter months.

The TELUS World of Science has done a great job with creating engaging exhibits for the whole family. As a group of adults, we all highly enjoyed ourselves even in a space geared towards children. The dome theatre has utilized new 360 filming techniques to put on some fantastic shows. The only downside were a few pieces have started to feel dated and could use a facelift.
Been here many times, never gets old. So many revolving exhibits and so many interactive aspects. Love the space exhibit and will be going to the animal inside out one shortly! Well worth it!

The new planetarium is amazing, my kiddo and I love laying down on the big bean bags and touring the galaxy. The rotating exhibits keep things fresh, especially when they're free admission exhibits. .... free parking

The dome theatre has utilized new 360 filming techniques to put on some fantastic shows. The only downside were a few pieces have started to feel dated and could use a facelift.
Been here many times, never gets old. So many revolving exhibits and so many interactive aspects. Love the space exhibit and will be going to the animal inside out one shortly! Well worth it!

We went taboggaining here for family day, was a great hill. Very big hill more suited for older kids wanting a fast ride. Was not very busy which was nice. Wish they was more of a designated place to walk up the hill as a couple times my boys had to bale because they didnt see kids walking up the middle of the hill.
As an Edmonton photographer I find Gallagher Park to have THE BEST views of Downtown Edmonton. It is a little bit tricky to access but it is totally worth it for the sunset view.
Amazing scenery of the Edmonton skyline at night. Also a quiet space to reflect and go for a short stroll.
Edmonton folkfest is a must for any Edmontonian or visitor a like. Great music and chill vibes. Best example of the  community of Edmonton
Loved it. Was a great hill to go sledding on. My kids definitely had a blast and want to keep going more and more to this park 😎👍
Great place to walk, but right now it's a good place to go to and visit. Not much of a trail system here right now because of the construction going on.

This is such a beautiful place to for family’s to come and enjoy time together. There is so much to see here and amazing details wherever you look. Take some time to really appreciate everything that is going on around here. 
I can’t wait for summer to come back so we can come back for a picnic and enjoy it all over again.
Its Beautiful my Brother and his wife got there wedding pictures done there I was a Bridesmaid
We droped the ball on our homeless EdmontonIan's.😢But would really enjoy the opportunity to volunteer for a clean up.

Great riverside park with a beautiful walk right beside the river. There is a Chinese garden area.  Free parking spots. It is easily accessible from downtown by way of the Funicular even if you are in a wheelchair. There are public washrooms available. You can rent Segways and bicycles for rent at River Valley Adventures   Overall it is a nice park right close to downtown with lots of walking paths and great views. We come here often and always enjoy it. You might even see a Garter snake

This is an amazing attraction that everyone should visit. 
My children were so excited when I brought them here. They wanted to ride up and down all day if I let them. 
My son wanted to see if he could climb the stairs faster than the elevator could get the rest of us to the top...and he did lol
The only downside...tons of people on peddle bikes that for some reason think it’s okay to ride their bikes into the elevator.

Has Edmonton put the fun in funicular?  Yes I think so.  It could be a little longer ride but that’s being picky. There are stairs beside the funicular that has rest spots on it if that’s your thing.  Either way there are spectacular views of the river valley. Once you are at the bottom of the funicular you can walk over to a viewpoint that is almost right over the river maybe about 75 feet up from the river. It’s new and well designed.  For those that are in a wheelchair there is easy access.
Lots of room in the funicular, for bikes, strollers, etc. There is a bridge over the river and on the other side an elevator to get to the trails
Newly added landmark to Edmonton. Nice view, and easy access from LRT station, bus stops, or library parking. Looking forward to different views during different seasons.
A hidden gem in Edmonton. A great place to go with friends and make sure to get the pizza. Definitely will go again.
My fave kilometre or so to bike in Edmonton. Apart from the tight squeeze (west side preferred). All seasons, fun to ride and the best, best views.
We always had a nice time, and we love driving on the bridge!!! And every time we drove by, we always take photos or videos!!!

Th High Level Street Car was Awesome. I highly recommend this when you are in Edmonton. Only 40mins of your time max . kids friendly easy travel.  And our Train Conductor named Ward is of the best gentleman and conductor ever. It was honor to meet Ward the conductor.

Always nice to walk across this bridge, especially at night when the lights are on, and it's a warm summer night with a cool breeze. It would be nicer if we didn't have to squeeze in slightly to avoid the suicide prevention barricades, but I agree with why they are there.

Great public space right in the middle of downtown.  Lots of activities and festivals take place here every year.  Please note Churchill Square is open but there is construction going on around it, and is still quiet for 2019.  All will be back to normal in 2020.  It’s an open and airy place.  I have been working downtown for many years in a building next to the square and come here often especially during the summer.  Just a great space for all Edmontonians to visit.  There are public washrooms available.

Absolutely in love with this place it is an amazing location to visit in the summer! It is a host for many festivals there is always something to do in the weekends, the fountains are so pretty as well - lots of photo ops with friends and family! I definitely recommend going to this place if it's a weekend and you have no plans.

I m a human, he is in stone,
Yet whenever, I feel all alone

I come here and sit with him,
he accepts with no smile or whim,

He listens to, what-so-ever I tell,
No ruckus or shout or raising the hell

In lovely spring, sunny springs, callous cold
I know of him, who will always keep me hold

Unlike the selfish world, he is true friend,and 
like flimsy, faltering people, he will never bend

A serene and nice place if you just want to be with yourself. I ❤️this place to bask this n sun in spring, enjoy the surroundings in all other seasons

It is awesome place to visit and have fun on weekends ..  It is at the  heart of the city . Easy access of ETS ... It holds different events throughout the summer. You can visit and enjoy this place any time. I enjoy to be there especially in the evening . I strongly recommend you to be there.
City Hall on a weekend is pretty fun while the market is there.  Lots to explore.  Would be 5 stars if it was warm enough to Wade in the pool without boots.
Good place to have Chinese food. They have more options.
Very nice and comprehensive service. I recommend
The food is good! I used to go on Sundays once upon a time for buffet! The variety and the quality is very good. It is inexpensive too
nice clean spacios place to have a good meal
Very open and bright. Lots of light inside and big windows.

My favourite place to go for a stroll downtown. The Victoria promenade runs along side 100 ave from 117 st - 121 st and offers fantastic views of our beautiful river valley. There are plenty of benches to sit, and there are staircases that connect you down to Victoria Park Road and the river valley
Great view of the river valley.
walking trail with a great view

This local gem is a public boulevard looking over the River valley, providing unique breath-taking views of Edmonton's number one green space. Plenty of locals congregate here in the spring and summer months. Great place to take a beverage and book, or maybe even some take out for an impromptu picnic! The possibilities are endless
Great place for nice walks and amazing view
Great customer service

There is nothing better than cultural Unity. This cultural organization especially a nonprofit organization such as this and many others that want to join as well have an opportunity to be heard to be seen and so we can all celebrate and love.
I'm sure every review of this event is top notch, except from people who've lived in the area.

We attended the festival on Saturday & Sunday and were disappointed by the lack of picnic tables, chairs  & covered tents for eating  & finding cover from the rain/sun. There were only 2 small areas where patrons could sit and eat and stay dry.  In prior years, the festival supplied large covered tents & picnic tables which accommodated a lot more  patrons giving them some reprieve from the rain/sun.  However; I noticed  there were no shortages of tables, chairs & covered tents for patrons of the beer tent.  We go to the festival for the music and rarely go to the beer tent.  Why is the festival  catering solely to beer garden patrons and not  the other patrons of  the festival?  I think more effort should go into making more room for people to be able to sit under covered tents to eat and stay dry or out of the sun.  Bring back the covered craft tent; that worked well and relocate it  where it used to be.  This would make more room for eating areas with covered tents.  On Sunday we felt like we were walking through the trenches , so much mud, wet and sand.  It was a real safety hazard if you had to walk over to Stage 5 or 6.  Why did the crew not foresee  the hazard here and  put down a  walking platform of some kind; they were totally unprepared.  What would it have cost?  Not much -especially since the festival spent $1000 to purchase hoodies for the performers to stay warm; performers should have had their own. Please consider making changes  in these 2 areas for next year.  Festival goers deserve better and like to be able to return with improvements.
really fun; volunteers are all great people; shuttle is very appreciable and convenient; view from across the city is the best
I love it every year! So nice how Edmonton comes together!

You take over several neighbourhoods to prevent people NOT interested in you from parking on public roads for four days in summer. When you are a mobility challenged senior who cannot walk 15 blocks to her favourite area, this is a loss of four days of life, not just a small inconvenience. The only purpose of such drastic parking limitations is revenue.
Awesome
Fantastic
Fun times
Loved it
Not good
Great store to buy meat at reasonable prices. Staff are friendly and helpful. The store is very clean as well. Something for everyone here.
Love this place. I have found memories from being young child & Lucky 97. Great place. Has items you can't find anywhere else.

The choices for Asian food varieties were abundance in this place, however, as with many other such stores, the spaces between the racks were a bit tight.   Sometimes one had to really such in the belly to avoid somewhat intimate contact with other fellow shoppers in the same alley.  Overall, the choices would perhaps overcome the potential awkwardness.

I don't fully trust the meat, and one of the aisles consistently smells like ball sweat, but the prices are great and the staff are always super funny and joke around a lot. A very unique grocery store experience for sure
Fresh vegetables, lots of Asian food to pick up. No disappointing as there would something you like😝

I booked a class for my mom and I to attend. The day of the event,  I received an e-mail saying the class was canceled due to not enough people booking it.  I understand things like these happen, and it wouldn't make sense for them to host the class if it is not worthwhile. However, when i asked for the funds back, I was told Gift Certificates are non-refundable, but i would get a credit on my account.  I never purchased a Gift Certificate. I purchased a class that got cancelled.  I initially emailed for a refund March 13. It is March 27th and I still don't know if I am getting my money back.
Just ok.  The Gelato is good as well as the coffee.  For the price the sandwiches are a big disappointment.  Should be able to use real chicken and not processed pre cooked chicken for $10 each.
Great food and awesome service, try the catering for your next event, high quality cooking and the catering manager will take care of anything you would like to enjoy.
Melanie in catering was very helpful and friendly, Eric did a great job and was very professional and helpfull in making our event a success.   The food was fantastic.   Great job, thanks.

My boyfriend and I would like to thank Von for an awesome night learning to make pizza! Von demonstrated and explained all aspects well, sharing valuable tips and tricks to enhance our knowledge and understanding of his trade. Also, his friendly dementor and humor added to our enjoyable experience. We had a great time and look forward to cooking with him again in the near future.

I was here over a year ago and gave it a four star rating, today they get a one.  Got there a little after twelve, someone finally took our order 15 minutes later and we finally got our food just before we had to leave at 12:50. I had to take mine to go and the server said "oh", no apology and she had an attitude. All of what I ordered and paid for was not in the bag.  Not sure what has happened here but I will not go back.  Sandwiches are $15.00 and today no service.  An hour should be enough time for a sandwich but obviously it takes much longer than that.  Find somewhere else to go if you expect lunch in an hour, good chance it won't happen here. 😟

Went there with friends and wasn't happy at all! First the waitress served me water in a dirty glass. We didn't think anything of it... then the food came. Horrible! The chicken tasted like it was rotten... like they had cooked rotten chicken. The sandwiches were definitely not worth the money. My friend felt sick after we ate. I wouldn't recommend this place unfortunately...think of the worst food place in the city and go there instead of this place! Horrible experience!

I've only been to this place for lunch.  The staff are friendly and efficient.  I've only had a few of the pressed sandwiches but I haven't had one I didn't like yet.  My favourite these days is the Panorama with fries.  The only downside to this place is that the kitchen seems a bit small and it can take quite a while to get everyone's food when we have a group of 8 or 10.  But this seems to be a common problem in a lot of places downtown at lunch.

I ordered the Salmon Pasta and a beer while staying in the hotel.  The "nowhere near" fresh salmon and unclean mushrooms were unpalatable, leading me to return my meal back to the waitress.  

The waitress did not seem to care at all that my meal was returned, took it back and dumped it out and simply brought me my bill.

This is the first time in 28 years that I have ever returned a plate of food to ANY kitchen or wrote a review.  That should speak volumes.

$25 dollars for a beer was my end result.

I love the people here and the great vibe. Sandwiches are great with good prices as well. This place is a saving grace for the attached hotel, which is not very good. They do indirect takeout delivery through third party service. 

I gave 5 stars initially, but I have rerated site have had a burger which was lacking. The meat was an unpleasant processed meat that had no consistency.

This place was my first time for Thai food. The red thai chicken curry with rice was really good. Not a big fan of the veggie rolls (very generous in size though). Cozy interior. Friendly staff. Will visit again if craving Thai.

Food was awesome, we were a group of four and we tried each other's dishes, there wasn't a bad bite. Service was really good, the waiter took his time and explained to us the food on the menu. We do  recommend this place and we will be going back for sure.
Nice little restaurant on 124st. Service was good. Price was decent. Would definitely go back.
The best Thai food I've ever had. My favourite restaurant in Edmonton without question. Love all of the Thai curries and Chu Chee Shrimp here. You have to go!
Excellent food...good service...note: order food in sequence as the kitchen seems to send everything at the same time....tasty spicey shrimp and sour soup +++++

The food is authentic and delicious. Their salsa has the perfect heat. I had the flank steak tacos on two house made tortillas with onions and cilantro. A little salsa and voila you have true Mexican food. Well done Tres Carnales. Highly recommend this place.

A very different kind of place, order at the front and then go sit down and I'll bring you your food. But come up to the front to pay after you finish. Makes getting food a lot easier, tho. Small place that tends to get busy during lunch. I do wish you could get four different tacos rather than all the same. The pastor tacos are amazing
Top notch food, great service, and a wicked atmosphere. Doesn't get much better than this. Great spot to hang with friends. Every taco we tried was sensational. No complaints.

Honestly, a pretty good taco. Delivered in flavour. Was expecting a different dining experience. More akin to almost to fast food in that way. Pleasant service. Lacking in the alcohol selection, tequila sunrise from a can...rough. Found guacamole bland.      
All in all unique little place but ultimately not what I was looking for in a dining experience. I personally won't be returning.

Have always heard good things about the quality of food and service here. 

When we first came in we were greeted warmly and given a simple explanation as to how things worked at the restaurant. We were also given some suggestions as to what to try. 

The nachos and guacamole are delicious. The tacos we ordered were probably the best I have had. The portions were big and the prices are reasonable. It has a fun atmosphere. 

Highly recommended.

Had brunch here this morning. Ordered the Southwest Breakfast Burrito, kitchen was out of black beans (the second main ingredient in the burrito) and rather then tell the waitress they served the food anyway; the kitchen should know better.  For the waitresses part, they did do their best to improve the experience, but that only goes so far when the food is not what you ordered.
What a wonderful charming place. The staff was attentive and very informative on what was on the menu. Clean and bright atmosphere. Being a retired chef it was a pleasure.
Been there many times for dinner, and always had very positive experience in the food and the service.  Really like the mood set by the decor/art work - warm, cozy & causal atmosphere.  Recommended!

Great service, always a wonderful experience. 

I enjoy that the plates and coffee cups never match. Unique and different lamps on each table create a personalized environment every time. 

Good price, good home cooked food. Enjoyed the vegetarian and vegan options.

Lots of vegetarian options. The shepherd's pie and quinoa soup was terrific. Although I considered having a whole meal of just appetizers because they all sounded so good too. Need to go back again so I can try more to things

I enjoy going to this location. Parking is limited but you can always find something on the street. Food is always fresh and consistent. It's sometimes underseasoned for my liking. Service is spotty, which others have written about. Enjoy their happy hour food+drink specials. One of the best patios in downtown Edmonton.

Recently this has become a better destination to go to, food wise. I used to not be a fan of the food served here. The new green menu they have is great. I have tried a couple dishes on it, both were great. I will definitely try the other veggie items on the menu as well. Happy hour prices are also excellent.

Was our first time here. We waited about 15 minutes before someone came to talk to us. However, manager Brianne came over and was very apologetic. Experience was very positive after this, food was quick and delicious and Brianne bought us round of drinks. Great recovery, everyone we interacted with was pleasant and helpful. I'll be back!

Earls has been a favourite for years. Always good service and great food!

Extremely pleased with the service received at the Tin Palace Location! We showed up and were actually quite upset with the quality of service we were receiving at first. At least until the manager Kayla walked by and noticed how upset we were. She immediately took over and remedied everything. 

I cannot give Kayla enough praise. She turned a horrible dining experience into a fantastic one and it’s great to see that the manager at this location cares so much! It did not go unnoticed and the extra care and attention was greatly appreciated. 

I would highly recommend Earls in general. If you love ribs like I do, then Earls has ALWAYS served amazing fall of the bone ribs that keep me going back. Although our initial service was suspect, Kayla at the Tin Palace location on Jasper Ave is absolutely fantastic! 

We will be sure to visit that location again!

Thank you Kayla, for such an amazing turnaround and fantastic dining experience!

Happy that I can finally eat here now that they have plant-based options!
I had the Crispy Tofu Zen Bowl which was honestly better than expected, the tofu was cooked perfectly! I found the sauce on the rice was kind of spicy as a warning for any other spice wimps out there.
Also had the white sangria which was nice, and had good flavour.
Only complaint is the service was kind of slow after the meal, other than that they were really nice and checked in on us, but after our meal we sat around for quite some time waiting to ask someone if we could pay.

Great consistent quality and service. I've never gotten a wrong order here nor have they ever forgotten anything. 
Their chili is great. I love getting chili cheese fries with pastrami on top. Their steak sandwiches are good, meat is tender, and come with a pickle (excellent pickle!). The burgers are great and larger than average. 
Their fries are always great.  Not too crispy and fluffy on the inside. A small fry order is about 1/3 of their paper bags full, it's a pretty generous amount. Enough for 2-4 people, depending on how hungry you are.

I can't remember a time when The Hat wasn't a local favorite. 

The food is excellent. All of it. Personally, the best is their chili-cheese fries.

I'm not exaggerating when I say I gained at LEAST 15 lbs in my mid 20's eating WAAAAAY too much chili-cheese fries with pastrami. 

The Hat's Pastrami are the standard for all other Pastrami places. 

Parking's just okay. Traffic in the area is terrible. But the food is worth it. It's been around for almost 70 years for a reason.

Pastrami burger, definitely has pastrami on it and some of the best tasting I've ever had the pleasure of eating. 

Outdoor seating is perfect for southern California weather. Enjoyed it on a Saturday in late January on our way to Disneyland.

Loved it! First time eating at "The Hat" had me there famous pastrami sandwich I will tell you what, I am most definitely coming back there not famous for nothing can't believe I have never been here before. I had there Onion Rings and the fries and it was also 💯👌🤙👍👊
This is where you will have the best pastrami sandwich you ever had, make sure to order the pastrami dip. Awesome!!!!!! is just what comes to mind.

I had a Greek salad.  It had lots of cucumber, tomatoes and onion, an adequate number of good olives, but not much feta and no anchovies.  Tasty dressing.  Price was high for the quality and quantity of food received. No reason to return.

Family restaurant with incredible food caring and meticulous service and you'll leave feeling full and satisfied! The will be relocating, their decor and intricate detailing are intimate and familiar - youll feel part of the family and dreaming of Greece.

Google maps currently lists the wrong address. 

Correct address: 10127 100A St NW

So, don't get lost!

PS I love the Greek potatoes.
Service was prompt and friendly, food was delicious and atmosphere was splendid. No complaints.
Very friendly. Good portions

Just got back from a work party. We booked a week in advance for a group of 8. Service was mediocre at best, the bare minimum. Took a long time to get drinks or order food and the waiter did not come around often enough and did not seem happy to be there. Then just after we ordered dessert they informed us that we had to leave as another party was coming in. They didn't even offer for us to move to another location yet the rest of the restaurant was empty (a sunday night at 6pm.. not exactly rush hour). They told us they could pack up our desserts even though they had arrived on plates at the same moment. Not happy as we had wanted to stay and chat and have drinks longer as it was our christmas party and we had picked that time specifically so it wouldn't be busy. Also very awkward to have another party come in and us still be in their seats.. Very unprofessional and bad management to book two events so close together. Food was okay. Nothing to rave about.

Loved this place. Our waitress was very nice. The atmosphere was great. And the food was literally the best meal out I have had in a long time. Every bite was amazing. I fully recommend it to everyone.
I had the chicken confit with duck fried rice. For an appy we had the parm. fries with a truffle aioli.
Poor, unprofessional service, and the food quality makes this place not worth the visit.

Best sushi in Edmonton! 
Every time I go here is always a great experience, whether it's by myself or with friends and family.
The sushi and sashimi dishes are always super fresh and tasty.
Dining in the private rooms is really cool.
The staff are very friendly and attentive.
Excellent service. Nice menu. Probably the best Japanese food in town. I didn't love the tuna tataki or it would have been a five star evening.

Without the segregated rooms just sitting at a table it loses some of its charm. The server seem to be more interested in getting me to pay the bill then offering anything else at the end of the meal. That may have been a language thing however the preparation of the food was still First Rate and the portions incredibly generous

Had a friends surprise birthday on April 1 at Mikados. I wasn’t to pleased with how the service works honestly. We had one waitress for 20 people it was abit chaotic and unorganized. The server Karissa could have been more friendly I didn’t find her to be very polite or engaging to anyone. I’m not saying you have to go out of your way to socialize but at least maybe smile. She didn’t seem thrilled to be serving our table. I also don’t understand why they take your order without asking your name so they remember what dishes you ordered. Then they come back not knowing who ordered what and just shout out the dish I don’t think that’s really appropriate it makes it more busy and loud when there is already a lot of people in this room. Between me and my girlfriend we ordered the wild salmon sashimi which I found was fresh but we also ordered three different rolls and I found some of the raw fish to be warm on top and it didn’t seem as appetizing since it should be cold. Overall I feel like Mikado could improve on their service and also the quality of the food that’s being served. I was especially upset about the service since we are paying an automatic gratuity towards the server which I think can be improved for bigger parties.
Nice quiet atmosphere. Waitress was cute and very polite. Food was great! Will definately come back.

Currently under construction but still has beautiful views of the river valley and downtown Edmonton. The food is pretty decent as well but I always go for the views. Once the renovations are done, I recommend making a reservation to eat on their patio because of the beautiful scenery. I would definitely recommend this place anytime in summer or fall, weather permitting.

Went to Riverside Bistro Saturday April 6, 2019 for a romantic evening and for a place that is reservation only you would expect good quality food. However, that was not the case at this restaurant.  We ordered an appetizer to start and it was so cold. We ordered the beer batter cauliflower and for a deep fried dish you would think you would see the steam coming out when you cut into the cauliflower but that was not the case. It came time to order our main course and they ran out of Jerk Chicken. The Jerk Chicken is the only chicken dish on the menu.... another disappointment. To say the least our evening just got better and better. We had ordered the 8oz steak and it was pathetic. It was worse then a truck stop steak. I got the vegetarian burger and it was really boring and dry. I found for a higher end restaurant that is "reservation only" to be on the lower end scale and over priced for what you get and the service was mediocre. The only good thing about this experience was the view. I personally would not recommend this place to anyone. Despite the view.... I would rather spend that kind of money elsewhere.

Had some food with the wife here and it was fine
    Love the big chairs ..

The patio has one of the best views in the city, so it's a great place for lunch on a nice summer day. Good is okay; about what one might expect from a hotel restaurant. Filling, and tasty enough, but nothing special. The times I've been there, service has been hit and miss. On one occasion, though I had a reservation, I was still asked to wait about 10 minutes.

Very friendly staff, the view is gorgeous and the plating is amazing. Can't give it 5 stars because some items are overpriced. But overall, the experience was lovely and would visit again for a special occasion.

What a fun place to go with a family that is really hungry and ready for some entertainment. This dining experience was entertaining from the start. Immediately as you get to the restaurant outside you have beautiful Japanese garden with some gorgeous prize-winning goldfishes. They kids had so much fun looking at them swimming and everything.  After all of that excitement we were able to be seated at a Japanese Hibachi Table with another family and kids so my children had a lot of fun interacting with everyone else around the table. As the chef came in he quickly started his show and it was fun interactive and very energetic. There was so much food!!!! Your portions are very large so make sure you come hungry. the typical Hibachi chicken dinner included rice vegetables and before that you get to have soup and salad. The only reason I took a star of was that the food was not as flavorful or authentic as I am used to but for being Japanese attraction chain spot it was sort of expected to be a little Bland however it was perfect for kiddos taste buds.

The food is surprisingly better than one might think. The salad that comes out with the soup prior to the meal is delicious I really like the dressing here. I did not care for the sushi as it did not seem as fresh as some places. The steak and chicken combo I ordered was well-cooked and affordable.

We arrived around 5:30, no one else in the dining area except for a group that was finishing up. We waited 15-20min before getting our drinks. A party of 16 arrived after we got our drinks. We had already ordered when another group joined our table. We still had not received our salads or soup an HOUR after being seated, but the party’s food was being cooked and served. Poor management. We were told that the party arrived before us, when they actually MOVED us from the table the party was sitting at to serve us quicker. The manager that I spoke with said “they knew what they wanted to eat, they had a list” I DON’T CARE if they had a list, we had ordered our food BEFORE the party placed their order. Waiting an hour and not receiving soups and salads is unacceptable in my book.

This place has always been pretty good. However the service has really gone down hill. No refills for the entire meal. Wrong food served. Appetizers brought after meal. Very small portions. Time to search for new place to eat.

Yes yes!! Best sushi presentation in Tennessee. Chef Boy knows how to make a birthday special. I told him to surprise me and yes I was surprised with a great sushi dinner.. will always be my go to place for sushi!!

If you love Italian then you must come here for a meal.  This restaurant is very quaint, small with a nice ambiance, and Ed the server adds to the experience.  The food, from the appetizers, main entrees, to the deserts, were all filling and delicious.  Definitely will come back again.
Always an excellent choice for lunch or dinner. Chef Maria makes the best meatballs in the city. Owner Matteo is always welcoming and convivial with newcomers and return guests. I'll be back soon.
Food's great, coffee's even better! Super friendly service and a really cool place to shop for stuff you don't usually find at your local grocery store.
Most of the food was awesome, except the spicy shrimp ,the waiter aloud children to order the shrimp without telling anyone how spicy it was.
Place was great, best food I've had in a long time, was treated awesome.

Hot spot for brunch! Good menu selection of 'the usual' bacon, eggs, toast. They also have breakfast sandwiches, skillets, breakfast burgers, omelettes, and other similar items. Tea and coffee as well as alcohol options, (Mimosa!) make your morning just as you like it!  Good quality food, if you have never been you are missing out.

Interesting menu with a decent amount of choices. I did feel like they tried too hard to be interesting as I didn't like some of the creativity that was taken with my food. For example, the chefs salad comes with cheese cut into strips which was super awkward to try and eat on the salad. But, it also came with a lot of meat and the flavour was good. They did put a lot of extra ingredients on it that weren't listed on the menu, and I would have asked for them to be removed had I know. Overall a good meal but I'm not sure I would return.

Nice little date spot. Great place to eat and good selection of items on the menu. It's a little pricier than expected but this restaurant was featured on that tv show "you gotta eat here " on the food network. Awesome burgers and sandwiches, would recommend the turkey burger. Only downside is not much of space to park and service is very slow, takes a long time for staff to come to your table to order or to catch their attention again for refills or to get the cheque. They have daily specials which I would recommend if you don't know what to try.
Awesome comfort food at reasonable prices. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is not too noisy.
The food and service is always great.  Love having this place in the neighborhood.  So much better than stopping for fast food and cheaper.

I was overjoyed that I got the experience to try this place and in perfect time for my fiance's bday. Bathrooms were clean and smelled nice. The food was DELICIOUS!!!! There so good chocolate cake and the lamb were my favorites and the best in the city in my opinion.I highly recommend this place for people to try. Its worth your money 😊
Great food and the best service I have ever experienced while out to eat. The decoration is so beautiful! The seafood chowder and crepes are amazing! Love this place.

Friendly staff and delicious food. Pricey, but worth it. Their seafood chowder and mushroom soup with balsamic reduction drizzle is to die for. As a celiac, I love that there's a HUGE selection of food. It's wonderful !

Always spoke so highly about here, came here every year for my birthday as well as our anniversary. Always had great service and the food was always great, was my favourite restaurant by far, until we were here the other day. The waitress literally never refilled our drinks the entire time we were there, and she literally kept walking right past us while helping everyone else around us, and the service was so so so slow, and food wasn’t very warm. Seriously seemed like we were invisible or she legit forgot we were even there or something. Didn’t even give a soup spoon with the soup like they have done every time I ordered it in the past, so I had to use the tiny spoon already on the table cause the waitress never even came back to check on us. Then we finally ordered our dessert and there was a huge long hair on my plate and of course I didn’t notice until I had already eaten a lot. It was clear that it did NOT fall off my sleeve cause my sleeves were rolled up and my hair was tied back nor do I or anyone in my house have long dark hair. Took the waitress about 30 minutes to finally come back then I told her about the hair and she was like oh well I don’t know how that would happen when everyone in the kitchen has hair nets. WELL ITS DEFINITELY NOT MY OWN HAIR OR EVEN FELL OFF MY SLEEVE. The manager came over and was a bit unprofessional, wasnt dressed professional at all and wasn’t very nice about the situation either. Didn’t even offer to have another one made for me. I’m sad cause this visit really ruined this place for me which sucks cause they truly do have the best french onion soup in the city. Total let down.

One of my favorite places to go but on the weekend called for a reservation but they said it was too busy on Saturday so made it for Sunday.  Service was slow and the orzo was bland. Took forever to get meal and even longer for dessert!  Staff said it was very busy weekend yet maybe just a handful of tables were there on Sunday night.   If staff tired ans cant handle post valentines perhaps they should close one day a week so the restaurant can catch up.  It’s very sad when your fave restaurant isn’t the same anymore.

The food was delectable. We woke up late, so we were there at around 10:30am. We did not know it closed at 11, it would have been nice if they told us when they seated us the food would be removed at 11am. The breakfast buffet is pricey at 31$ but the food was delicious. 

I ordered the fresh squeeze juice but did not know it was 10$ per glass, I would not have ordered it if I had known. The server was an absolute mensch. Some of the greatest service I have ever received. It was an Asian gentleman, I regret not taking his name. You can opt to sit on the patio with its illustrious views.

Overall, I enjoyed the experience and would dine again. The price deters me from leaving a 5-star rating. However, it is a Fairmont, so it is expected.

Service was exceptional and the food was fine - though not exceptional.  We booked our dinner reservation to celebrate a birthday and the plan was to order the three course a la carte menu.  Then, finding out it was Edmonton Downtown Dining week, we switched to that three course dinner special instead.  It was fine but, in retrospect, it would have better suited our occasion and hopes for a truly exceptional meal to stick the the well respected Harvest room menu.  Oh yes, our son did enjoy his smoked Manhattan (and we all chuckled when the diner's at the next table table reported smelling smoke I. The dining room).

We had a memorable date night at the Harvest Room. It overlooks the North Saskatchewan River Valley, giving us a gorgeous view during dinner. We loved the romantic setting, and the staff was super friendly and very knowledgeable in the food and wine they serve.

Service is excellent, the food is pretty good. Not quite what I would expect for the level of hotel it is. Definitely need more flavor in the food. While simplicity is nice, it almost bordered on bland. We went for the Fall Harvest menu and the lamb sirloin was actually bland tasting. Not what I expected. It was okay. Jacob was excellent and very attentive. Thank you!

Loved the ambiance and setting of the Harvest Room.  Really wanted to love our whole experience but the food was a big let down.  The food was so bland and looked sad (lacked color, style, textures).  We’re glad the meal was a downtown dining deal because we would have been extremely disappointed to pay full price for this.  So many other high end restaurants to go to that make better use of ingredients in more creative ways.

Wow. First of all the atmosphere is warm, inviting and high end. Our waiter was charming and shared a few laughs with our table as well! The dry aged rib eye was spectacular providing rich flavour and nutty notes. The lobster mac and cheese was also amazing! Overall anyone wanting a great place to celebrate an event or to just have a relaxing dinner, or perhaps watch the game, this is the place for you!

Wow is all i can say, the flavor of the food is absolutely amazing! From the bread and there signature bacon to the rib eye steak, everything tasted better than i could have imagined, while the green beans were a tad to salty I would still highly recommend this place to anyone who is tired of being disappointed at "regular" resteraunts! This place is a cut above the rest!

Amazing food and great service! What more can you ask for? We'll be back for sure! 

It's on the expensive side but well worth it! Wife and I had some of the priciest items and had a large glass of wine each. Just under $200 with tip. Can't wait to go back!

Nice ambiance! We ate in the bar section and we enjoyed a lot our evening. Great selection of fine liquor and tap beers. We ordered the lollipop ribeye which is one of the best steaks you’ll ever eat (for 69$ apiece we expected it a little bit). Only issue is with the overall pricing... 9$ for a bottle of regular sparkling water, 4$ for half a cup of steak sauce and nothing much on your plate besides your steak... So be ready to spend money if you actually want a full meal!

Great service, lovely decor & delicious food.

 Reccommend:
 any steak & the lobster mac & cheese. The oysters are pretty good as well.
Wow a bottle of Chardonnay and two pastas dishes! The calamari appetizer is amazing. We can’t wait to go back to try other entrees. Great waiter as well.  Good job!!

Absolutely one of the best dining experiences I've had in the Edmonton region not only is the ambiance lovely relaxed and very classy but the staff is above and beyond my expectations. Not only does the owner of come around and personally check on your table and make sure that everything is up to yours and their standards but the staff is quick efficient and very welcoming. The food is probably some of the best Italian food I've ever had everything is made fresh to order and is an absolute Delight! Go here you wont regret it!
The food was good but not unbelievably good as I was expecting. It is pricey there. I wouldn't go again unless its for the cheese wheel pasta which is what I highly recommend.

Always amazing. I never review anything but I will review this place because the food is terrific and the  staff is kind and friendly. Get Violino Special if you want to see something truly unique. A+++

I booked a Valentine's Day dinner at Violino and felt like a number at a deli counter. I had not been there before so I do not have anything to compare it to, but it seemed like they packed much too many people in to the tight area to maximize profits. The service was as good as it could have been for how many people they were trying to serve. It was a set menu that looked great on paper. My only complaint about my food was that my soup was cold, typically I don't blink at things like that, but I felt that the price of the meal did not leave room for cold soup. I addressed the issue to my server and she discounted one of my drinks off in lieu, which I appreciated. My wife and I finished out meals quickly and left, because the atmosphere was not conducive to the romantic meal and evening we had planned. All in the cost for the two of us was a little over $300.00, I would be hard pressed to ever return on Valentine's day again, but feel I would have a vastly different experience spending the same amount on a day other than Valentine's day.

Just got back from a work party. We booked a week in advance for a group of 8. Service was mediocre at best, the bare minimum. Took a long time to get drinks or order food and the waiter did not come around often enough and did not seem happy to be there. Then just after we ordered dessert they informed us that we had to leave as another party was coming in. They didn't even offer for us to move to another location yet the rest of the restaurant was empty (a sunday night at 6pm.. not exactly rush hour). They told us they could pack up our desserts even though they had arrived on plates at the same moment. Not happy as we had wanted to stay and chat and have drinks longer as it was our christmas party and we had picked that time specifically so it wouldn't be busy. Also very awkward to have another party come in and us still be in their seats.. Very unprofessional and bad management to book two events so close together. Food was okay. Nothing to rave about.

Loved this place. Our waitress was very nice. The atmosphere was great. And the food was literally the best meal out I have had in a long time. Every bite was amazing. I fully recommend it to everyone.
I had the chicken confit with duck fried rice. For an appy we had the parm. fries with a truffle aioli.
Poor, unprofessional service, and the food quality makes this place not worth the visit.
Old Strathcona is great, especially Whyte Ave, cannot wait for the proposed Centre line LRT to run down here.
Fine

Honestly, 
All of the good hairdressers who used to work here are leaving.

Kayla was fantastic, but got moved to another location.
I got my hair cut there this summer by Mike, and he did an amazing job. He considered my hair type, my face shape, and everything I wanted. i should have asked if he was in instead of  just rushing in for a cut.

This young girl with long brown hair cut it yesterday.... there are chucks of hair on top of my head that are 1-2 inches long (I have shoulder length hair) and this is her idea of "thinning out" my thick, coarse Asian hair.  It feels rough and hairs are literally sticky straight out from my layers. the bangs are literally halfway up my forehead when I asked for 'side-swept' bangs. My left side was untouched (and perfect, thanks mike!) and she made my right side 1 inch shorter while "evening it out."I told her that I was growing my hair out and needed a trim....it'll probably take me half a year to grow out this horrible mess to something to salvage from her mess.

In other words, Ask for Mike.
It's a great place. Young croud. Quiet to watch a hockey game.And meet your friends for a chat over a drink. I like it. Oh by the way it's Saturday evening and it's open.
Great organization

In my opinion the U of A has some of the nicest buildings in Edmonton. I am a photographer and love bringing my clients to the grounds for either wedding or engagement pictures. If you are not here for photos it is just a nice relaxing place to walk around, especially in fall.

The University of Alberta (also known as U of A and UAlberta) is a public research university located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. It was founded in 1908 by Alexander Cameron Rutherford,[6] the first premier of Alberta, and Henry Marshall Tory,[7] its first president. Its enabling legislation is the Post-secondary Learning Act.[8]
Offer a huge amount of classes. Most professors are good while others should not be teaching. Campus is quite nice
It is one of the best Universities in Canada.
One of the best Universities not only in Canada but in the whole World.

In my opinion the U of A has some of the nicest buildings in Edmonton. I am a photographer and love bringing my clients to the grounds for either wedding or engagement pictures. If you are not here for photos it is just a nice relaxing place to walk around, especially in fall.

The University of Alberta (also known as U of A and UAlberta) is a public research university located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.
