Offer a huge amount of classes. Most professors are good while others should not be teaching. Campus is quite nice
It is one of the best Universities in Canada.
One of the best Universities not only in Canada but in the whole World.

Love the diverse movies shown here. Where else can you watch 20+ year old movies for the first time right on the big screen?? Saw Spirited Away for the first time here and it truly blew me away. Something that a home theatre just can't give you.
Great old theatre. Comfy enough seats and always interesting and unique movies.  The popcorn is great as well... Way better than big chain theatre popcorn.  Staff is great and really into movies!

In my opinion the best theatre in Edmonton. Love the vintage feel and it’s a great night out. Order a drink too the metro is licensed. if you want to make a night of it go for dinner at any of the amazing restaurants near by. Metro you are doing some great things.

Fantastic atmosphere, comfy seats, great pricing on snacks and drinks. Staff are polite and helpful. Very clean and tidy. Generally attracts a great crowd, people seem to be respectfully quiet during films.

Metro is a great place to catch a movie, and the prices are very reasonable.

They are consistently a source of a wide variety of films, not just the same lame blockbusters you see at the Cineplex. I also appreciate that they partner with community groups to bring important films to the public and support worthy causes.
We have a season subscription to Shadow Theatre. This production was a pleasant surprise, it was made even stronger by the quality acting on all performers' parts.
There is no bad seat. The incline is far greater than most venues in the Strathcona area, so whether you’re at the front or the back, you’ll get a clear view.
I delivered a grand piano there a few years ago and loved the atmosphere. Thespianism at its finest!
Best small theatre venue in the city located in the heart of the Theatre District.  Always busy, always a great evening.
Fantastic theatre. The people that work here and put on the shows here make it such a wonderful place!

Turning into the parking access is a nightmare. It would be very helpful if they could get someone to direct traffic so the left hand turn was easier. Every time I go to am event they change where you pick up tickets. My walk to the box office was not needed as they escorted me to the back entrance where the parking lot is.  The sound in this venue is outstanding.
Great venue. View of the stage is good, even from upper balcony. The sound quality is excellent as well. We went to 'Come From Away' recently and it was fantastic!
Very nice auditorium. First time I have ever been here and it was for a concert. Prices are pretty high for concession and drinks but not inconsistent with other concession areas I guess.

Wonderful concert space, it can be a bit tight to move around in though, if you have any mobility concerns I would say get there early and ask an usher for the best way to get to your spot. The staff are always lovely!

When to a concert at the Jubilee Auditorium recently. Had a an amazing time. The venue was amazing. The seats were nice and comfortable and easy to find. Lots of leg room. Like that they had a coat check and was rather inexpensive. Also the parking structure was right behind the venue, literally less than 2 minutes to get to the car, parking price for the evening was $5. Also venue is super close to the LRT station. Bathroom we very clean and wait times were short. Concessions were reasonable priced or what could be expected.

As a current employee, I HIGHLY recommended this facility to my family when my grandfather was looking for placement after an accident. This is the best facility with the nicest staff and clients everyone is super friendly and willing to help even if its not their line of duty. I truly look forward to coming to work everyday due to the clientele and my coworkers.
We use the campus every week and they are just outstanding!  Highly recommend using this place for any endeavors you have!

FEB 2016 - Beautiful home. Had a couple awesome nurses and aids. But a lot of fake smiles (from owner too) and talking. Mom left in her room for after asking to go to exercise would forget about her (this happened more than once) It was so sad to see the disappointment on her face.. .Make sure you put a camera in room so that you can watch your family member too. We lost mom in in less than a year after putting her in there.  Wish camera was put in from day one not just the last month and a half. Big disappointment in care and management. I'm the one that needed to tell the nurse she needed taken to hospital the last time she was there they were waiting for a NP to come in and do her rounds. Mom needed to be put on vent/bipap when taken to hospital. I would definitely check out other places.

“Cute and quaint”
There is so much history to Columbus that we never new about. After visiting Heritage Corner, we understood so much more. It provides a great summation of Columbus, the dams, agriculture, and how the city developed through time. Great place for kids to learn.

Short and sweet: The worst facility I have ever dealt with. I'm an advanced practice nurse with almost 10 years of clinical experience, and I have NEVER EVER dealt with such an incompetent facility. My Dad came there for a rehab stay and the facility never told us any information about his discharge date until they told us one afternoon his insurance was denying him staying any further. My Dad had 10 fractured vertebrae and could not do a whole lot himself, and this supposed "rehab facility" gave us ZERO advance notice of any discharge date. So my Dad had to be discharged without occupational therapy making any home visits prior to his discharge, my Mom had to scramble to contact my Dad's cancer doctors to get prescriptions ordered to take home, we had to urgently find a medical device company to deliver a lift chair last minute since that was the only device my Dad could rest or sleep in, and on and on. Then, when I called to complain about the lack of planning, some administrator named Kelly spoke over me for several minutes, and then when I became frustrated, she HUNG UP on me!!! I called back, and she HUNG UP again!!! I've never seen such a poorly run facility, with jerks for staff members, and a complete lack of empathy. Another example, one night my Dad asked for his pillow readjusted and the Nurse said that's not my job, and left the room. DO NOT TAKE YOUR FAMILY MEMBERS HERE!!!!
I'm sure every review of this event is top notch, except from people who've lived in the area.

We attended the festival on Saturday & Sunday and were disappointed by the lack of picnic tables, chairs  & covered tents for eating  & finding cover from the rain/sun. There were only 2 small areas where patrons could sit and eat and stay dry.  In prior years, the festival supplied large covered tents & picnic tables which accommodated a lot more  patrons giving them some reprieve from the rain/sun.  However; I noticed  there were no shortages of tables, chairs & covered tents for patrons of the beer tent.  We go to the festival for the music and rarely go to the beer tent.  Why is the festival  catering solely to beer garden patrons and not  the other patrons of  the festival?  I think more effort should go into making more room for people to be able to sit under covered tents to eat and stay dry or out of the sun.  Bring back the covered craft tent; that worked well and relocate it  where it used to be.  This would make more room for eating areas with covered tents.  On Sunday we felt like we were walking through the trenches , so much mud, wet and sand.  It was a real safety hazard if you had to walk over to Stage 5 or 6.  Why did the crew not foresee  the hazard here and  put down a  walking platform of some kind; they were totally unprepared.  What would it have cost?  Not much -especially since the festival spent $1000 to purchase hoodies for the performers to stay warm; performers should have had their own. Please consider making changes  in these 2 areas for next year.  Festival goers deserve better and like to be able to return with improvements.
really fun; volunteers are all great people; shuttle is very appreciable and convenient; view from across the city is the best
I love it every year! So nice how Edmonton comes together!

You take over several neighbourhoods to prevent people NOT interested in you from parking on public roads for four days in summer. When you are a mobility challenged senior who cannot walk 15 blocks to her favourite area, this is a loss of four days of life, not just a small inconvenience. The only purpose of such drastic parking limitations is revenue.

Simply the Best of Edmonton.  World renowned EIFF has been on for 31 years. Attention to film makers make this festival unique.

Friendly accommodating staff. 

FESTIVAL RUNS FIRST WEEK IN OCTOBER

Hands down one of the best sweet places in town. I love the area and the look of the place. The reason why is not 5 stars is because they change their sweets to much and don't bring some back. I had a white chocolate peach cake and it was heaven. Even a person that hated sweets for years though it was the best cake hes ever had. Please bring it back and I promise you I'll give you a 5 star review

The desserts are beautiful and sophisticated but I find time and time again their taste doesn't live up to their look. I've had their ice cream on a waffle cone, not bad, ruined though by the fact that my cashier who just handled cash also handled my food without hand washing in between or at least making a better effort of not touching the food. Almost every time I've been there I've noticed fruit flies in the dessert display case.  I want to love this place, especially since its much needed renovation.... Great ambience, I'm just not sold on their desserts -what they're supposedly known for... much better places in the city.

Let's start with the atmosphere that welcomes you as you walk in the door of Block 1912.  From the tile mosaic that greets you on the outside step to the exposed brick wall with all it's perfect imperfections this cafe welcomes you with character.  Then as you wait to be served you are given the opportunity to survey the multitude of desserts.  I have still to have a bad experience with their food or the drinks.  Try the chai latte, one of the best in the city so far as I have tried.

This is a great place to go for coffee and deserts. They have a variety of different deserts to try. I had the carrot cake and it was really rich with flavour. Their lattes are also really good with a smooth taste. Love this place and will be going back.

Love the live music, can be a great places for studying if you go early in the morning. Love the atmosphere and it’s a great place to talk with friends and catch up. Only downside is how expensive it can get, definitely not an everyday cafe but more for a few times a month

Great bubble tea in a nice neighborhood! It attracts a trendy crowd and has a good arrangement of hot and cold drinks and foods. There can be a lineup, but there is good music and service to keep you busy. They also have large murals and booths. It is immaculately clean as well. We'll recommended!

I don’t know what’s with Dream Tea- Oliver location but I pay a different price every single time I buy the same drink.. they must be doing magic when you’re paying or something and of course no one checks how much they pay so they get away with it. 

I didn’t realize this until there were two times where I had to pay with cash and was surprised to find out that it’s also what keeps happening every time I used my card to pay. For this reason, I don’t go to this location anymore. Make sure you know how much your drink should cost and only pay that amount. 

Their rewards program is also great but is different than all other locations in the city. At Oliver, after earning your free drink with 9 stamps, you are limited to choose from their regular bubble tea (I don’t like their bubble tea and don’t even order them)... so it doesn’t make sense why I am forced to choose from a section of the menu I don’t even look at. The stamp card says “free drink” but it should say “free drink - limited to regular bubble tea”

They also have the most unfriendly staff.

Conveniently located in Oliver Square. It is right beside a couple restaurants to wash down the heavy food you just had. The bubble tea is fairly good (sweet) and well priced. Make sure to get their loyalty card where you get one free bubble tea after every 10th visit. They have tables inside and also sell a few food items, though I've never ordered them.

Chicken was decent and yam fries were good. Wait times were really long though; the bubble tea took about 10 minutes and the food took about half an hour. The staff aren’t really friendly or welcoming and they didn’t acknowledge us when we came in. There’s a lot missing from the menu as well, so I wouldn’t rely on their online menu. It was okay, I don’t know if I’d come back again though.

I'm slowing working through the menu. I really like the red bean texture it's also creamy. The tappico has a really nice chewyness. Their self titled "Dream bubble tea" is a mix of coconut and taro that is divine.

This is my favourite veggie spot in Edmonton. Today I tried the unicorn burger. Let me tell you, it tasted like something you'd find at the end of a rainbow. The staff were friendly, and accommodating of dietary restrictions, specifically asking if we had any. The only downside is it felt really stuffy, crowded, and warm in there today. It will be nice when the windows can be opened again!

Grabbed dinner here with a group of four, everyone loved their meals (3 out of 4 being carnivores, so that says a lot). We shared the vegan wings, which I'd actually order again over actual wings, they were so good. I also had the Cafe's version of mac n cheese, delicious! The atmosphere was cozy and relaxed and the service was really friendly. I would definitely come back.

As an omnivore I can say that I did not miss the meat at all eating here. The textures and flavours are amazing. The food comes in reasonable portions so you won't find yourself overeating. The Eggs Benny and Smoothie Bowl were delicious. If you want some creativity & wholesomeness with your food come here!

Arrived right at opening on Sunday morning and got a table for 6. Our waiter was super nice and deinks and food were quick quick! Drinks were good, a little more expensive but I would say worth it for a good latte. Food is great! We had a mix of vegan/vegetarian and meat eaters and everyone left happy so no complaints! Definitely a good place to check out.

Vegans and Veggie Heads this is your restaurant! The food is spectacular and the flavor combinations are surprising. Their hot drinks are spectacular on a cold day too.
Try any of their turmeric drinks, you won't regret it!

I first met Dr. Caouette after an accident in the early 2000s when I needed to find a good dentist to repair my smile. His office used modern technology along with an incredibly patient-centered approach to care to alleviate my concerns and repair the damage, making my smile (and confidence) better than ever! 

When he moved to open his new clinic, South Central Dentistry, a few years ago I made sure to track down his new location so I could continue being his patient. From every experience I've had with him, it has been abundantly clear that Dr. Caouette cares deeply about his patients. He is absolutely one of the very best at what he does and I cannot recommend him more highly!

If you need an incredible dentist in Edmonton that cares about you and your smile, give Dr. Caouette's office a call.

My wife has been going here for most of her life and recommended me. I had to have 5 appointments relatively close together. Was a GREAT experience, with friendly staff who worked wonders, and organized my appointments perfectly to maximize my benefits coverage. 
Simply put, I COULDN'T BE HAPPIER!!!

Dr. Caouette and his team are really thorough and caring.

Both my wife have gone here and definitely recommend this practice to any friends that are looking for a great family dentist.

My family and I have been patients of Dr. Jerome Caouette for more than 6 years.  We have wonderful experiences at the South Central Dentistry.  The facility is modern and very clean. The clinic staff are polite, courteous and professional. They always make us feel comfortable. 

Dr. Cauette’s work on fillings, bridges and crowns I had in the past is outstanding. He is gentle, very knowledgeable, and professional. I truly believe that Dr. Caouette is one of the best dentists in Canada.

I would definitely recommend Dr. Caouette and his dental clinic.

I’ve been seeing Dr. Caouette for about 4 years now and he is by far the best dentist I’ve ever been to. As someone who is quite anxious and typically uncomfortable going to the dentist, he has always made me feel super comfortable and is extremely gentle I’m regards to fillings, etc. My wisdom teeth removal was seamless, the conscious sedation technique he uses is incredible. I don’t remember a thing, I barely had any swelling and was eating solid food the next day. I’d highly recommend him and his colleagues to anyone!

Great family diner with a traditional 50’s/60’s atmosphere. The burgers are pretty good and so are the fries. The prices are also pretty good. The service is prompt and the servers are very friendly. It is a wonderful little place to stop by for some food or a fun date. There is also a large parking lot so you don’t have to worry about paying for parking or do street parking.

Great family diner with an old style atmosphere. Veg food was available but pretty generic (veggie burger patty from Costco, vegetarian pizza with everything - onions, pineapples, loads of cheese on it, you get the picture). Would love to see some more unique/healthy veggie options in the future. Good prices and fast service. Would definitely come again!

Amazing food! So so so delicious! Such a beautiful atmosphere! I really wish there were more places like this. Very friendly and polite people as well! Just loved it all around!
We took the photos when had already started eating.

Food is simple but good, everything you'd expect from a diner.  Very cool decor and atmosphere, appropriate prices.  Service was decent, but I felt very bad for the poor waitress. Only one person to serve and bus a very busy restaurant. Considering the circumstances, she did as good a job as possible. I hope for her sake they usually have more staff.

I'm undecided if it's the food or the ambiance that attracts me to this place...but if you haven't been here before it's a Edmonton location that should be highlighted on "drive inside, dinners and dives"!! The foods always good and if it's not they'll make it right...and it seems like every time you go back you notice something different up on the wall. Give it a try, I don't think you'll be disappointed at all!!

How can fried dough taste so good?  Great staff.  Quick and friendly service!  Bring a bib or just don't care like everyone else.  There is so much powder sugar your gonna make, but nobody cares because it taste so good.  They have two lines one for take out one for eat in, the lines are long but move quickly.

Very delicious, both hot chocolate & coffee were perfect! You do seat yourself upon arrival, I recommend during busy times to just sit at a table that may still need to be cleaned if needed. Service comes fairly quickly & they cleaned our table & then took our order very kindly. It is cash only, so be prepared, I think the closest ATM was across the street. Overall, pleasant experience, however be prepared to wait during peak hours of the day. We went during a rainy evening & had little to no wait.

This is a requisite stop for New Orleans. We went very late at night but this place was still pretty active at midnight. Service at that time was very good, as soon as we sat down a waiter came and took our order. Food and drinks came within 5 minutes. I give the place 3 stars because while the beignets and coffee were very good, I didn't find them any different than any of the other places that offered them. However I still recommend coming for the experience and to see the world famous Cafe Du Monde.

Absolutely loved Cafe Du Monde. It's a huge tourist attraction so the wait can be long, however we visited for a morning brunch and got seated in just a few minutes. The Beignets are truly to die for! The hype is real! All that fluffy sugar goodness takes you straight to heaven!

Go to the original find an available seat  and be ready to order.  One of the few touristy things in life that meet expectations but then again its coffee and donuts.  However, both very good and the atmosphere is amazing.  Set close to the street if you can and enjoy the performers.

Great place to enjoy some comfort food and to satisfy your sweet tooth. Portions are large and food tastes great. Lots of vegetarian and gluten free options. Restaurant is very clean and staff is very friendly.  Will definitely return.

The service is excellent. I find the menu and the food bland. It's a comfortable environment, with solid basic plates. They're very proud of their directly sourced ingredients, but it doesn't come through in flavor in the menu options I've tried. Super cinnamon buns, without doubt, and the borscht is also excellent. If your folks from the country are in town, this is a good choice; otherwise, I think there is more adventurous value to be had in Edmonton.

Friendly environment, good for kids. Great staff and comforting food. 

Note: their home made ketchup is delicious BUT not vegan as far as I can tell (has Worcester sauce)
Amazing cinnamon buns and bourbon sauce. Ketchup is wicked too - they sell their own ketchup there! Extremely busy on weekends, expect to wait a while but the line moves fairly quickly.
Need better parking choices, however, it is located in an area that you wont find good parking.  Food choices are ok, prices a little pricey. Quality of the food is good. Atmosphere is good too.
The decore needs a bit of work, but the food and bbq experience was amazing! The staff is very helpful and friendly. Good value for what you are getting!! Definitely recommend this place!

The BBQ meat was very tasty and marinated perfectly. It was our first time there and we were stuffed because it was all you can eat! I topped it off with 2 servings of ice cream. It was super busy there so we had to wait a bit until we got seated. Make a reservation in advance! Be prepared to smell like BBQ but it was so worth it. Will def come again.

I was craving for a korean bbq because it has been years since i had eaten korean bbq. So when I googled for korean resto this is the closest to my place thats why we went here. I was quite suprise when i got the bill, i even ask my wife how much was it per person, it was way overpriced and there’s not much of food selection. The place was dirty especially the washroom smells like a sewer. It was disappointing for a first timer. I would not recommend it and will not go back again.

My friend and I paid 40 dollars each and in 20 dollar bills because it was 35 per head, and we never got our change back. It’s overpriced for the quality and/or freshness of the meats. The rest of the buffet was very minimal and about lesser or same quality as the proteins. After eating, we were waiting to be picked up in that little room that separates the actual entrance from the eating area, and on the other side of the door (not the exit), someone started knocking on it in an unpleasant way. We assumed that they no longer wanted us there, however, verbal confrontation would have been much more polite and professional. Not coming back.
This restaurant is  very cozy and feels very comfortable I love to going there. Plus right up stairs are several personal room for karaoke. I had fun so much after dinner ^^

Amazing selection of beer on tap with some of the best and brightest microbreweries out there. Their food is incredible and cannot be missed out on. If you have the chance get the brisket do it its just insane! They also do group events upstairs and it's a beautiful space for that. All around great establishment definitely check it out.
Great atmosphere. Fantastic Service. Had the Mac & Cheese with Bacon. Unbelievable. But next time I'm wearing sweats and sitting in a booth so I can stretch out after that Bowl of Awesomeness.

Nice place, food is good. Great selection of beer! Downstairs is a little loud, so if your looking for something a bit more quite so you can hear each other better opt to sit upstairs 🙂 also in the summer the patio is great.
Great place for drinks and food.  Great selection of beers and food tastes pretty good.  Olivia was our server and she treated us very well with high level of attention.
Brisket was not very tender and was a bit fatty. Nice servers, but they had no idea whether the brisket would be fatty or not. Cornbread was good but dry. Excellent craft beer selection.

Food was very tasty and well done. Server was excellent at ensuring our celiac dinner had only gluten free food. Good specials and we all left very full. Any of the curry's good choices and the crispy tofu is excellent.

The food was great and the atmosphere was very relaxed. I recommend this place to anyone but know what you're ordering!! Ask questions! Or better yet, look through their little black book with pictures of every dish they offer!

Holy delicious food, Batman. Had dinner here with Tea, Coconut Rice, Ginger Beef, Lemongrass Chicken, and Black Bean Vegetables. Servers were prompt and extremely nice to talk to. My Dad and his Wife had a Soup Appetizer, they really enjoyed. Even the water had cucumbers and mint in it. 

Make sure you don't park in the Circle K parking lot, because you can be at risk of getting a $100 ticket. This is very clearly posted in the restaurant. Underground parking is available. 

Deserts looked wonderful, but we were too full to try them.

A good restaurant but as other reviews has stated it caters more to Western tastes rather then authentic Thai food. Which is evident by the picture book accompanying the menu. 

The poppy shrimp are very good they come with this curried mayo that is pretty good.

The restaurant itself is clean, the service is attentive and they always came around asking how we were doing. 

Overall it's a good restaurant that would be a good first venture for somebody looking to try Thai food.

This is the best Thai food in Edmonton， their curry tastes super good.  Their food are fresh and clean. The environment is great and the staffs are really really nice.  The wait time is short， their dishes comes out fast. This is my number one recommendation for Thai food in Edmonton.

Food is amazing, top notch, seasonal dishes. It is on the expensive side, however you are paying for a beautiful night out with amazing food! Menu changes seasonally so you can enjoy all of the chefs creations. I had the baked cod that came with some Brussels with a bacon something rather sauce. I can't quite remember the name but it was one of the tastiest things I've had in a long time!

Spend your next anniversary here, get a bottle of wine and have a slow meal, you won't regret it!

My boyfriend are constantly trying testing out different restaurants in the city, we look for places that are more so on the 'fancy' side. We went to the Red Ox Inn a couple nights ago, and I can confidently say that it was by far all around the best meal I have ever had. 

The appetizers, the meal, and the desserts, were all a 10/10. I did not catch our waitresses name, but she was wonderful, and she made me the most amazing ceasar I have ever had in my life. 

The only negative thing I have to say is that it was very uncomfortably cold in there. So I do recommend bringing in a sweater or a comfy jacket to wear throughout your visit, especially if the weather is cooler outside.  

I will definitely be back here!

Even with the small food menu - there is a variety of food. The food was amazing. No doubt about that. Our server was pretty friendly. It gets pretty cold in there, as it is a small place and you feel the fish of cold air whenever the door opened. Wish they spent a little more attention in the atmosphere of the restaurant as it’s still very important for a dining experience. We also had a very loud table beside us which made the whole place super loud for a small place.
The service is professional, and the food is outstanding. This is one of our favourite places to treat ourselves because we know it’s always incredible! Thanks RedOx for being consistent!
Pricey. Food was good but not great. The service was good. I had the beef and I found that it was a little plain but the steak sauce was too strong

First and foremost the food was excellent. Everyone in our party had a different dish and each was excellent, tasty, and well prepared. 
The service was top notch and the restaurant has a great feel. Not so formal as to be uppity or stifling, not so casual as to be off putting. Just a nice, calm place with a relaxing  atmosphere that invites enjoyable conversation with your dinner companions.

Great atmosphere, excellent service, and the best meal I've had in a long while

Edit: I came back a second time and am now removing a star for this review. The food was still good, but my $50 steak was not as good as expected - it had quite a bit of gristle. I would expect a nicer cut of meat for such a price. Also the waitress forgot about us for the first 20 or 30 minutes that we were there.
The food was definitely tasty, but for this second visit, it was not worth the price.

Apps were very good, but the main course was an epic fail! My wife and I paid an extra $4 to share the 8oz fillet, we were told they would cut the steak in half and bring it out on separate plates with extra veggies to justify the cost. We asked for it to be well done which is our preference. When the steak came out it was at most 2cm thick for both of us. After mentioning how odd this was, we were told they cut the fillet horizontally before cooking it which to me makes no sense. It was bland and had no taste. Most fillets I buy are 3 inches thick, so 4cm in total for ours was disappointing and honestly did not look or taste like a fillet. They did offer to cook a new one, but we were already full. We got free desert which was nice but should not have had to pay for that atrocious steak. This is their best cut and it had no taste or flavor. Extremely disappointed and will not come back. This is not the place for a really good steak like it had been in the past. Sad
This restaurant is the best! The horseradish was so spicy!!! I liked the servers they were very kind to the kids and the adults. I’d totally recommend this restaurant to my friends and family.

Was very over charged for what I got. Was part of a big party so had a set menu. Which is fine. But we weren't told the prices. Also, I have a food allergy and was treated like I didn't. I had to exchange / miss out on some food/ one course. Still charged over $80 for a basic salad, mediocre steak and fries, and no dessert.

The food is excellent here! If you're looking for a quick bite, this isn't your place until you have time to kill. They make everything up fresh and it shows! Well worth the wait! My favourites are the chicken and beef shawarmas, and the BBQ chicken baker!
I felt like I was eating at my Yia Yia's; the food was excellent. Service was efficient and friendly and helpful. Lots of room to sit and eat.

Employees need to be trained on allergies and should not answer if they are not certain. If you are not sure, then say so.  Some allergies can be a life of death situation!  Thank God it wasn't like that for my husband. Just bad hives and being very uncomfortable for the rest of the day and into the night.  Won't go back since we can not trust the information given.
Love this place. Always clean and the food is fresh!
Food is overpriced, and greasy. The atmosphere of the resturant also leaves something to be desired.

Everyone enjoyed the 4 hour visit to the Zoo today. There were eight of us from ages 18-55. I haven’t been for a while and there are some lovely new facilities. We attended three presentations put on my Zoo staff and they were really informative and worth the trip. The Zoo keeper scattered food all around the lynx’s enclosure. The cat came out and found all the treats. She was beautiful. The Seals love their new pond! They were so happy jumping and playing. The Red Panda’s are in a temporary enclosure where you can easily see them - SO adorable. Even the sloths were active. There were only a few animals hiding so we saw almost everyone. The Zoo is worth the money.

Probably my favorite happy place in Edmonton! I have always loved the zoo, and I'm so happy to see progress, new buildings, the animals are very well cared for, loved and in great shape. I even adopted the tiger(s) this week, and will most likely adopt more animals. These pics were taken March 12, 2019. I have over a thousand pictures of all the animals there...it's absolutely a lovely place to go for the entire day. Great gift shop, a nice café to eat and a lot more on site....and the parking is free.

Full disclosure, I was considering booking the Otter room for an event but haven't actually booked anything yet, so not too sure on service. But, the facility itself is gorgeous, the city has done amazing work in putting together a visually stunning building. They include tables and chairs in a booking, and I believe you can rent out exclusive after-hours access to the zoo if you book an event there. Its the zoo so tons of parking with tons of standard Edmonton-sized pot holes, make sure to drive slowly , it's pretty brutal. Still, awesome potential spot for a private party.

The Edmonton Valley Zoo has come along way in the last 20 years. They have dropped the "storyland" version of years gone by nicely and have become a more professional looking Zoo with a wider variety of exhibits. As I understand, most if not all of the animals have some sort of injury and could not support themselves in the wilderness, so keeping them in captivity enables them to survive. I applaud the changes and will be back!

We visited the zoo today. My 7 year was on a school trip, and we tagged along with our 2 years old. Mind you it’s spring and the it’s warm but not for all the animals to be out and about. We saw the Leopard, wolves, a tiger, bunch of zebras but could see Lucy the elephant. I would suggest going their April onwards. Great nice place with a cafe, vending machines and an ATM. I wanted to see more animals but it was still cold and the trails were icy and wet. I have attached the map and other important info about the place have a look and enjoy.

Love this place! Great atmosphere and amazing staff. The food is delicious! I have never oncehad a bad experience here. Also their cocktails are on point. Cactus Club Cafe is s definite go to restaurant when I want a nice treat.

Great food, great atmosphere, good service - their happy hour menu doesn't break the bank and has some delicious items. The rest of the menu can get pretty pricey but we had a great experience. My friend and I chatted for about an hour after paying the bill, if the server had come back we likely would have ordered another drink but we were left alone after paying.

All star treatment and fantastic food - I can't rave enough about how much I enjoy having a special night out here.  The service is top notch and the cocktails are delicious.  I especially want to mention Manager Lonny French who was an absolute gem for us on Saturday night. My stepson knocked over his drink and I tried to catch it, but instead caught a shard of glass in my hand.  After asking our server for a band-aid, Lonny came to our table and provided me with proper, professional first aid and care that is better than what I think I would have received at any hospital.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart for making our special night out even better!

Ok I would like to explain my 3 star rating. First of all it has nothing to do with the food. The food is excellent and I have never been disappointed with the food any time I have been there. I find that the atmosphere is very posh. It doesn't seem inclusive of everyone. It almost sends the message that only certain type of  people would be comfortable eating there. If the restaurant only wants a certain type of clientele it is doing a great job. My boyfriend refuses to even eat there because of the image it sends. Which for me it's unfortunate because as I have mentioned before the food is fantastic. :)

I had my birthday dinner here last night. AMAZING! My server was Josh and he was fantastic! Did magic tricks for my nieces and showed them how to do the tricks as well. He was very attentive and knowledgeable.  I will be back and requesting him 100%. Thank you for the awesome experience!

Try the smoked Old Fashioned!  You won't be disappointed.  Awesome service and great food.  My fave is the prime rib which melts in your mouth.  Plenty of parking but can be easy to miss.  It's right behind the Best Buy.

Enjoyed a delicious dinner after staying at the hotel for the night.  Steak was perfectly cooked and prepared.  Had a Sangria pitcher, its very tasty and a must have.  Eaten at a Chop restaurant in other places and this one holds up to the quality you expect.
The food was great, and the staff was even better! Specifically Andy who made the entire experience such a delight! He was so friendly and went above and beyond. Definitely would come back!

The food here was quite good. It was a busy night my meal came over cooked, however they completely replaced it in no time and gave a voucher for another free meal, and not only that they gave my meal free. Great customer service and really appreciate everything thrown in, I was perfectly happy with just my meal cooked to perfection like it was round 2, but thank you

Arriving right at noon, my table of 5 found the lounge area not too busy - we had a table immediately. The wait staff was very friendly and responsive (I had a Pepsi refill before being aware I had finished!). Our meals came out in unison and, to my knowledge, everyone enjoyed what they ordered. However, out of three of us who ordered the steak sandwich, two found the steak less cooked than requested, but only by a thin margin - certainly not enough to dampen the experience. I'll definitely go again and would recommend it to others. Thanks for the experience!!
Probably the best burger I have ever eaten, ever.  A must taste burger place. Service was super friendly and swift. Good selection of beer on tap, fries were crispy and hot, no ketchup needed.
Love the food options and that you can create your own burger! It's a great place for a casual hang out.
Always have a great experience here. Good food and decent prices!
A perpetual favorite for me and the boys. Love the burgers there.
Excellent food and really good service. It was a busy dinner time during my visit, and we were a larger group (7), but the food came quickly and was phenomenal.

This is the BEST ITALIAN RESTAURANT in Edmonton! By far.... The staff are Amazing, Warm, and Welcoming. As for the food, The value for the dollar is amazing since on portion could leave you with leftovers for 2 extra meals. Also coming from a big Italian family when I had my first bite of the Gnocchi I had to ask if they had my Nonna(Grandma) making the food in the back. Overall Highly recommend this restaurant.

Wow...from the warm greeting at the door to the fantastic food. Only word that can describe my evening out with friends is Wow. Piccolino will not disappoint you. But the line up to get in was long...so book a reservation to avoid the wait.  Definitely worth the wait as the food and service is second to none. Love this place, the atmosphere, service and food is amazing. I would consider this a hidden gem in Edmonton!!!

THEY ARE THE BEST! I have never had such great food before.  Even if you are not a fan of the best Italian food in edmonton,  it's worth going for the general kindness of the staff/owners. As soon as you step in you are greeted and part of the family.  Guaranteed you will go there and have a sense of welcome,  which will stick with you after even leaving.  Just some really good people making some really good Italian food!

The food here is excellent, the portions are wonderful, and the service is amazing. I would recommend this little family restaurant to anyone and everyone. The menu is sure to have something for everyone. I had the Artic Char with Mango salsa and it was so fresh and delicious. Best I have ever had.

Wonderful, personal service.  Food is delicious.  They don't try to rush you out.  You can enjoy your wine and food while you visit with friends.  Also, it's a family business and I'd prefer to spend local and support my community.

Amazing French cuisine!  Gini's has been around for quite some time, and it's easy to see why. Portions are just the right size. Staff are well informed and can provide menu guidance. Lunch time can be busy, but weekday evenings are quiet and intimate. Be sure to leave room for dessert; they're amazing.

Excellent food in a quaint restaurant.  Portion size was very satisfying and service was very good.  The only very minor complaint was that it was a bit warm in the restaurant.  It would have been nice if the air conditioner and/or the overhead fan was on.  Nevertheless, will definitely be coming again!  Most certainly very fine dining.
Great food at reasonable price. Service is always prompt!
The food is amazing however, the service was slow and the decor is dated.

I give this restaurant a "good enough" rating. I'm not sure why it has a 4 1/2 star rating, but our whole table was unimpressed. The food was adequate, but not great. The service was ok. Here's how I sum up my feelings about Gini's based on my one experience: would I go again? I guess. Would I be excited about it? No.
